void eol_button_get_stock_size ( eolUint *  w,
eolUint *  h 
)

gets the dimensions for a stock button

Parameters:
w output. if set, it will return the width of the stock button in pixels
h output. if set, it will return the height of the stock button in pixels

Definition at line 234 of file eol_component.c.

eolComponent* eol_button_new ( eolUint  id,
eolWord  name,
eolRectFloat  rect,
eolRect  bounds,
char *  buttonText,
eolUint  buttonType,
eolInt  buttonHotkey,
eolUint  buttonHotkeymod,
eolBool  center,
char *  buttonFileUp,
char *  buttonFileHigh,
char *  buttonFileDown 
)

creates a new button component

Parameters:
id the id for this component. This should be unique per window.
name the name of this component. This should be unique per window.
rect the component position relative to the window bounds
bounds the window rect.
buttonText the text to write on the button. Can be NULL
buttonType see button type enum above.
buttonHotkey the SDLKey hotkey that this button listens to. 0 or less is none
buttonHotkeymod the SDKMod that this button listens to. 0 or less is none
center if the button should be centered on the rect or aligned to it.
buttonFileUp if specified it will attempt to load this file as the button idle image
buttonFileHigh if specified it will attempt to load this file as the button highligh image
buttonFileDown if specified it will attempt to load this file as the button pressed image

eolBool eol_component_update ( eolComponent *  component  ) 

runs the appropriate update function on the component. This is called automatically interally to EOL. It should not have to be called directly.

Parameters:
component the component to be updated
Returns:
eolTrue if the component has update information or eolFalse otherwise

Definition at line 741 of file eol_component.c.

eolComponent* eol_entry_new ( eolUint  id,
eolWord  name,
eolRectFloat  rect,
eolRect  bounds,
char *  output,
eolInt  outputLimit,
eolUint  justify,
eolBool  wordWrap,
eolUint  fontSize,
eolLine  fontName,
eolBool  number,
eolVec3D  color,
eolFloat  alpha,
eolVec3D  bgcolor 
)

creates a new entry component

Parameters:
id the id for this component. This should be unique per window.
name the name of this component. This should be unique per window.
rect the component position relative to the window bounds
bounds the window rect.
output a pointer to the buffer where the output will be stored
outputLimit the length of the output buffer
justify how to draw the text in the entry (see eol_font justify enum)
wordWrap if the text should wrap around or be a single line
fontSize stock font to use to draw the test.
fontName if set it will attempt to use this font instead of stock
number if true, it treats it as a number input and follows that logic
color text color
alpha text transparency
bgcolor background color. Should be in contrast to color.

Definition at line 1590 of file eol_component.c.

eolComponent* eol_label_new ( eolUint  id,
eolWord  name,
eolRectFloat  rect,
eolRect  bounds,
eolBool  canHasFocus,
char *  text,
eolUint  justify,
eolBool  wordWrap,
eolInt  fontSize,
char *  fontName,
eolVec3D  color,
eolFloat  alpha 
)

creates a new label component

Parameters:
id the id for this component. This should be unique per window.
name the name of this component. This should be unique per window.
rect the component position relative to the window bounds
bounds the window rect.
canHasFocus not all labels can have focus, nor should it make sense
text the text to display in the label
justify how to align the text (see eol_font justify enumeration)
wordWrap if this label should word wrap or not
fontSize stock font size
fontName if not NULL, it will try to load the specified font for drawing.
color the text draw color (1,1,1 is white)
alpha the text draw transparency (1 is opaque)
Returns:
a newly setup label component or NULL on error

eolWord  name,
eolRectFloat  rect,
eolRect  bounds,

eolVec3D  barColor,
eolFloat  startPosition,
eolUint  sliderType 
)

created a new slider component using common settings

Parameters:
id the id for this component. This should be unique per window.
name the name of this component. This should be unique per window.
rect the component position relative to the window bounds
bounds the window rect.
vertical if eolTrue the slider will be set up as a vertical slider, horizontal otherwise
barColor the color to draw the bar
startPosition the starting position of the slider
Returns:
a pointer to newly allocated and set up slider or NULL on error.

gets the current position of a slider component does component type checking

Parameters:
the component to check
Returns:
the slider position (0-1). Set to 0 on error.

Definition at line 1277 of file eol_component.c.

eolComponent* eol_slider_new ( eolUint  id,
eolWord  name,
eolRectFloat  rect,
eolRect  bounds,
eolBool  vertical,
eolLine  slider,
eolLine  sliderHigh,
eolLine  bar,
eolLine  cap1,
eolLine  cap2,
eolVec3D  barColor,
eolVec3D  sliderColor,
eolFloat  startPosition,
eolUint  sliderType 
)

created a new slider component.

Parameters:
id the id for this component. This should be unique per window.
name the name of this component. This should be unique per window.
rect the component position relative to the window bounds
bounds the window rect.
vertical if eolTrue the slider will be set up as a vertical slider, horizontal otherwise
slider the slider graphic to use
sliderHigh the highlighted slider graphic to use
bar the bar graphic to use
cap1 the bar end cap to use (top or left)
cap2 the bar end cap to use (bottom or right)
barColor the color to draw the bar
sliderColor the color to draw the slider
startPosition the starting position of the slider
sliderType the type of slider (see enum above).
Returns:
a pointer to newly allocated and set up slider or NULL on error.
